com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface

Interface PaintSurface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, GridSurface, ObservableSurface, ScalableSurface, ScanlineSurface, ScrollableSurface, SwingSurface
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PaintCanvas
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPaintCanvas, AbstractPaintSurface, JMonetCanvas

    public interface PaintSurface
extends ScanlineSurface, GridSurface, SwingSurface, ObservableSurface, ScrollableSurface, Disposable
    A component that can be painted and that provides methods for drawing at scale, snap-to-grid behavior, scrolling, observables, and embedding Swing components.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cursor getCursor()
      Gets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
      Dimension getSurfaceDimension()
      Gets the un-scaled size of this painting surface (that is, the size of the image being painted).
      boolean isVisible()
      Determines if the canvas is visible.

      Causes the entire surface to be repainted by Swing.

    • Method Detail

      • setSurfaceDimension

        void setSurfaceDimension(Dimension dimension)
        Specifies the un-scaled size of this painting surface. This determines the size of the image (document) that can be painted by a user. This does not specify the size of the Swing component or otherwise adjust layout or presentation of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimensions of the painting surface

      • getSurfaceDimension

        Dimension getSurfaceDimension()
        Gets the un-scaled size of this painting surface (that is, the size of the image being painted).
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the image being painted

      • repaint

        void repaint()
        Causes the entire surface to be repainted by Swing. Note that repainting large regions is computationally expensive, whenever possible tools should repaint the smallest sub-region possible using the repaint(Rectangle) method.

      • repaint

        void repaint(Rectangle r)
        Causes a section of the surface to be repainted by Swing. This is the minimum rectangle that will be repainted; there is no
        Parameters:
        r - The region of this surface to be repainted.

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Determines if the canvas is visible.
        Returns:
        True if visible; false otherwise.

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether the canvas is visible. When invisible, the component hierarchy will be drawn as though this component does not exist.
        Parameters:
        visible - True to make this canvas invisible; false for visible.

      • getCursor

        Cursor getCursor()
        Gets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
        Returns:
        The active cursor

      • setCursor

        void setCursor(Cursor cursor)
        Sets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The active cursor to display
